thread.title: Divorced wife can claim medical expenses in addition to maintenance: Kerala HC

author: Mahir Haneef
title: Divorced wife can claim medical expenses in addition to maintenance: Kerala HC
text:
KOCHI: The Kerala high court has asked a Muslim husband to provide for treatment of his divorced wife who is ill, in addition to paying maintenance.
Justice B Kemal Pasha issued the order after considering a petition filed by a Muslim woman from Kozhikode who produced medical records before the court while seeking treatment expenses from the former husband in addition to maintenance.
A lower court had ordered for paying Rs 3,60,000 due to her by calculating maintenance at Rs 3,000 per month. Considering an appeal filed by the husband, a sessions court had ordered for reducing Rs 45,000.
During the hearing at the high court, it was argued by the woman's counsel that she is suffering from a serious illness and had incurred Rs 2,31,000 towards medical expenses. The woman demanded that the medical expenses should also be ordered to be paid by the former husband.
Pointing out that the law permits courts to order a former husband to provide an amount that is fair and sufficient for the woman to lead her life forward, the high court said medical expenses can also be included in it if there are sufficient records. http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/followceleb.cms?alias=treatment,maintenance,Divorce Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
